title: Billingham Beck Valley Country Park Walking Route

images.title: peter robinson / Visitor Centre Billingham Beck Valley Country Park
images.caption: Visitor Centre Billingham Beck Valley Country Park

images.title: Philip Barker / Pond near Visitors' Centre
images.caption: This photograph shows a view of the pond near the Visitors' Centre in Billingham Beck Valley Country Park. The picture was taken looking in a northerly direction towards Wolviston.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Bridge Over Billingham Beck
images.caption: Bridge Over Billingham Beck. Another view of Billingham Beck; this time looking upstream from the other side of the tunnel/bridge under the railway

images.title: Mick Garratt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Davis Bridge, Billingham Beck. The name Davis Bridge appears on the OS 1:25000 and, if the normal OS practice of writing the name to the north east of the feature has been applied, then it is the name of this "tunnel" under the Stockton to Billingham railway. Alternatively it might be the name of the nearby road bridge carrying the old A19 north.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Heron at Billingham Beck Country Park
images.caption: A Heron peers into the pond at Billingham Beck Country Park

images.title: Ian Barton / Footpath by Billingham Beck
images.caption: Footpath by Billingham Beck

description: This country park is located on the south western side of Billingham, on the pretty Billingham Beck. There's some pleasant nature trails with ponds, a picnic area and lots of wildlife to look out for. Birds include Herons and Sparrowhawks with water voles, weasels, rabbits, hares, and the odd deer to look out for too. Cowpen Bewley Woodland Park is only a couple of miles to the north east so it's easy to extend your outing here if you have time. The park includes a lake, a beck and some peaceful woodland trails. Wynyard Woodland Park and Coatham Woods are other good local options.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is popular with dog walkers so you will probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For cyclists National Cycle Route 14 runs just past the park. The trail can be followed to Cowpen Bewley.

display_address: Norton Road, Billingham Green, Billingham, Stockton-on-Tees, Tees Valley, England, TS23 1DU, United Kingdom
